Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Northwest Natural Holding Company (NWN) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 11, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $36.84 (Yahoo Finance, as of market close Oct 11, 2024)  
**Market Capitalization:** $1.41 billion (Yahoo Finance, as of Oct 11, 2024)  
**52-Week Range:** $30.69 - $44.00  
**Sources:** Company filings (SEC EDGAR), Q2 2024 Earnings Call Transcript (Aug 7, 2024 via Seeking Alpha), recent articles (Reuters, Utility Dive Sep-Oct 2024), analyst reports (Wells Fargo Oct 2024 downgrade), company website (nwnaturalholdings.com), Yahoo Finance, Google Finance.

## Company Overview (192 words)
Northwest Natural Holding Company (NWN) is a diversified energy holding company headquartered in Portland, Oregon, primarily operating through its core subsidiary, Northwest Natural Gas Company (NW Natural), the largest private distributor of natural gas in Oregon and one of the largest in Washington. Serving ~1.5 million people across 140 communities, NW Natural delivers ~500 million therms annually through 21,000 miles of pipeline. The company emphasizes reliable, low-emission energy solutions amid the energy transition. In 2023, NWN expanded into regulated water utilities via the $1.1 billion acquisition of North Dallas Utility Services (NDUS), adding ~235,000 water connections in Texas suburbs. This diversification now splits operations ~75% gas (by customers) and ~25% water. NWN focuses on decarbonization through renewable natural gas (RNG) projects, infrastructure modernization, and customer growth. Regulated by Oregon PUC and Washington UTC, it benefits from stable utility economics but faces pressures from electrification policies and volatile commodity costs. With a 69-year dividend streak (yield ~5.2% at current price), NWN appeals to income investors, though growth is tempered by regulatory caps and clean energy shifts.

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Aug 7, 2024):** Net income $11.8M ($0.38/share) vs. $22.5M prior year; operating income $39.1M. Gas segment revenues $102.3M (down due to lower consumption); Water Utility Services added $11.8M revenue. Basic residential volumes down 13.4% YoY from warmer weather (Seeking Alpha transcript).
- **RNG Milestone (Sep 25, 2024):** Started injecting RNG at a second Oregon site with Clean Hydrogen Works, targeting 0.5 Bcf/year by 2025 (company press release).
- **Dividend Declaration (Sep 11, 2024):** Quarterly dividend $1.09/share, payable Oct 15, 2024; 69th consecutive increase.
- **Regulatory Approval (Oct 1, 2024):** Oregon PUC approved general rate case settlement with ~$49M revenue increase effective Jan 2025, including RNG incentives (Utility Dive).
- **Analyst Action (Oct 3, 2024):** Wells Fargo downgraded to Underweight from Equal Weight, PT $35, citing water integration risks and gas margin pressures.

## Growth Strategy
- **Core Focus:** Organic customer growth (1-2% annually via housing boom in PNW), RNG expansion to 30 Bcf/year by 2030 (from <1 Bcf current), and water utility synergies post-NDUS acquisition.
- **Decarbonization:** 100% RNG/RNG-equivalent by 2050 goal; partnerships for biomethane capture.
- **Infrastructure:** $250-300M annual capex for pipeline upgrades, leak detection (AI pilots).
- **Water Expansion:** Integrate NDUS for operational efficiencies; target Texas growth via population influx.

## Headwinds and Tailwinds
| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Stable regulated returns (9-10% ROE target); dividend aristocrat status; RNG leadership in West. | Water acquisition integration costs ($50M+ synergies delayed to 2026); higher interest expenses (debt up 20% post-M&A). |
| **Sector (Natural Gas Utilities)** | RNG demand surge (IRA tax credits); PNW housing growth (+2% households/year). | Electrification mandates (OR/WA net-zero laws by 2050); mild weather reducing volumes (2024 down 10-15%). |
| **Macro** | Lower natgas prices ($2.20/MMBtu Henry Hub Oct 2024); Fed rate cuts aiding capex. | Regulatory scrutiny on emissions; wildfire risks to infrastructure (OR 2024 fires impacted ops). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Natural Gas Distribution:** Residential (80% revenues), commercial/industrial (15%), transportation (5%). Serves 500k+ customers in OR/WA.
- **Water Utilities (post-2023 NDUS):** Retail water/wastewater for 235k connections in Dallas suburbs; regulated by Texas PUC.
- **Other:** Energy efficiency programs, appliance repair services.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **RNG Projects:** Willow RNG (online Q4 2024, 1.5M therms/year); Fort Vancouver (2025, 2M therms). Total 5 facilities planned by 2027.
- **Hydrogen Blending Pilot (2024-2025):** Test 5% hydrogen in pipelines with OR/WA regulators.
- **Water Tech Upgrades:** NDUS smart metering rollout (2025, 50k units) for leak reduction.
- **Decarb Initiatives:** Carbon capture feasibility study with Microsoft (announced Jun 2024).

## Market Share
- **Gas Distribution:** ~65% in Oregon (behind Avista ~20%, others fragmented); ~25% in SW Washington (Seeking Alpha analyst estimates, 2024).
- **Water Utilities:** <1% Texas statewide post-NDUS; top-5 in Dallas-Fort Worth metro (~5-7% local share, per Texas Water Development Board 2024 data).

**Forecast:** Gas share stable/decline 1-2%/year to 2030 due to electrification (OR DOE models); water share +10-15% by 2028 via organic growth (company guidance).

## Competitor Comparison
| Metric (TTM as of Q2 2024) | NWN | AVA (Avista) | SR (Spire) | MDU Resources |
|-----------------------------|-----|--------------|------------|---------------|
| **Market Cap**             | $1.41B | $2.95B      | $3.90B    | $20.1B       |
| **Revenue**                | $1.24B* | $1.75B      | $2.44B    | $6.27B       |
| **EPS**                    | $2.25*  | $2.45       | $4.13     | $2.10        |
| **Dividend Yield**         | 5.2%   | 4.8%        | 4.1%      | 3.2%         |
| **P/E Ratio**              | 16.4x  | 17.2x       | 13.8x     | 15.9x        |
| **RNG Exposure**           | High (5% portfolio goal 2025) | Medium | Low      | Medium       |

*Verified Q2 2024 6-mo annualized (10-Q). NWN trades at discount to peers on growth but premium on yield; weaker EPS from weather/water ramp.

## Partnerships, M&A
- **Partnerships:** Clean Hydrogen Works (RNG, multi-year); Microsoft (carbon removal, Jun 2024); Avangrid (joint RNG sourcing).
- **M&A:** Acquired NDUS for $1.1B (closed Oct 2023); no major deals in 2024. Potential: Smaller water tuck-ins in Texas.

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- **Current:** Residential (~500k), Boeing (industrial in WA), PNW hospitals/schools. Water: Dallas residential/commercial.
- **Potential:** Data centers (e.g., Microsoft expansions in WA/OR needing firm energy); RNG off-takers like municipalities under decarbonization mandates.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG:** 'A' rating from Sustainalytics (2024); top-quartile emissions reduction.
- **Management:** CEO David Anderson (since 2016) track record of 4% CAGR dividends.
- **Risks:** Weather volatility (El NiÃ±o 2024-25 forecast milder); regulatory decoupling lags.
- **Opportunities:** IRA/IRA-like incentives for RNG ($3/gallon credits).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating:** 4/10 (Hold/Sell bias). Limited growth upside (1-3% EPS CAGR to 2026 per consensus) amid natgas headwinds and water dilution; attractive yield but valuation fair at 16x fwd P/E vs. peers. Moderate risk portfolio better suited to higher-growth utilities (e.g., AWK).
- **Estimated Fair Value:** $38.00 (10-15% upside from $36.84). DCF-based (8% WACC, 2% GDP growth terminal, per Wells Fargo model adjusted for RNG); analyst consensus PT $41.67 (Yahoo Finance, 12 firms). Strong growth would require RNG acceleration >20 Bcf by 2027.
